Posts.Content: what worked for me was a big bowl of high fiber cereal in the morning. then I added a brisk walk of 1.5 to 3 miles, most time didn't finish before I felt movement. I did this starting my 8 weeks of SRT, then continued to help build my strength back. The HT has been the worst problem to deal with between the surgery and radiation.
Posts.Title: Constipation from hormone therapy?

Posts.Content: been having semi erections on my own and some help from my wife, dry orgasms but nothing like this. the other thing after HT and SRT felt weak and short winded. my Urologist kind of blew it off as not having testosterone, went to a Cardiologist. ended up getting 3 stents, last check up about 5 years no problems. now I am on blood thinner, blood pressure meds and one pill for irregular heart beat. I asked my cardiologist if it was safe to take the Viagra since it had been about 8 weeks and he said it was fine. maybe a combination of the drugs that made be squirt.
Posts.Title: Had a problem after taking a Viagra for the first time

Posts.Content: about half hour taking the blue pill, got in the shower and washing up got a chub working. do not know if it was the anticipation or cleaning that I started getting little Elvis to come to life. after showering the feeling coming back I started squirting urine every couple of minutes. to say this killed the moment is a under statement. this went on for couple of hours and was a disaster. really not sure what was going on, had no control over it. with the RP, HT and SRT have not been able to have a full erection in 1.5 years. off the HT now and my testosterone is starting to recover so I was hoping Viagra would work. anyone else have this happen? my wife has been understanding and we have been working thru this.

Posts.Title: Had a problem after taking a Viagra for the first time

Posts.Content: I am with MichiganMan16, why the hurry? Takes about 90 days for the remaining psa to wash out . At 1 month mine was 0.06, 2nd month 0.07 and 3rd at 0.08 a slow steady climb. Around the middle of the 4th month started on Eligard HT at which time my psa was 0.10, 5 weeks later started 39 SRTs. Seems to me he is jumping the gun, HT is a cash cow for the Doctors. It was proven I had a reoccurrence before starting HT, it is very hard on your body. I opted out of HT several months after completing SRT and it affects the body up to a year after stopping. Dr. Pat Walsh believes it better later than sooner, after going through it I do too. HT will rack your body, say goodbye to the twins, hello hot flashes, fatigue, weight gain, muscle and hair loss or thinning. The SRT is tolerable, watch what you eat, no spicey food, empty colon and full bladder, not much to it.

Posts.Title: Hormone therapy..how long?

Posts.Content: tested by my GP for low T, started therapy. started with Androgel for 3 months, did not feel much better. time for more blood work, started monthly injections for 3 months. felt better for a coupe of weeks then lows again. 6 month bloodwork still low T, monthly shots. at 9th month started every 2 weeks injections, felt like a young man, started loosing weight and gaining muscle when working out. it is my understanding besides just checking T they check your PSA and cholestrol level. after about a year on low T therapy had my checkup and results showed a PSA of 10.6 Filled out forms to get my medical records including my lab reports. got medical records prior to starting TT, no lab results. everytime i contact them they say they have sent them and will send again. asked my Urologist to get them but only results from my checkup. should i consult with an attorney, i know this didn't give me PC but probably kick started it. i am sure they have purged my records. should i follow up or just let it slide.
Posts.Title: On testosterone therapy for 1 year prior to finding i had PC

Posts.Content: state medical board mandates you to have a PSA and cholesterol checked if you start Testosterone therapy. i am saying my Doctor never checked my PSA level, just my testosterone level which was either 168 or 186, can't remember what the nurse told me. every 3 months for a year had blood work done, just saying if they did check my PSA level they never mentioned it. when it was checked on a routine physical it was 10.6 at the end of october. 10 days went to the Urologist and a DRE and blood drawn, scheduled a biopsy by my choice for after Thanksgiving. biopsy confirmed that had PC, gleason score of 8, staged a T3b. i just don't think this happened overnight and if he had actually done the blood work, he did draw the blood. they either didn't test it or never looked at the results. have asked on 3 separate occasions for my medical and lab reports which they have failed to do. i prevouisly signed a consent form for this, i did recieve my records prior to starting TT. Had my RP on feb. 3rd and one limp node that tested positive. now i have had HT and finished salvage radiation treatmants oct. 3rd. I have nevered sued anyone, does seem like malpractice?

Posts.Content: I am 68 and just had my 4 year anniversary from RP. Had HT and SRT and have watched my T every time my PSA was checked. Original URO wanted me to stay on HT for 3-5 years but I opted out after a year. Changed URO a couple after finishing SRT. From what I have decided from reading not all doctors are against starting on T therapy. Instead of taking the shots I asked URO to start me on Clomid. Side effect of the female fertility drug when given to men makes you increase your natural T rise. My T doubled after 1 month and my PSA has stayed at zero,

Posts.Title: Testosterone post-surgery with PSA "undetectable" 5 years?

Posts.Content: my PSA had a steady rise after RP, finished my SRT on Oct 3rd. I am on HT now, hope I do as well you have done. congrats on the good news. did you any HT too? for gsteve, i had very little side effects from the SRT. 6 weeks in started having a little burning from both ends. usually started friday night thru Sunday morning then started the week and did not show backup to Friday. just watch you eat, for me no spicey or tomato based food. don't eat anything that gives you gas and quit any vitamin. try to have ampty colon and a full bladder. what worked for me was high fiber cereal and brisk walk of a couple of miles to make sure everything was moving. drink a big bottle of water on the way.

I opted out of HT 6 months after finishing SRT, took 6 months for my testosterone to even get back to 300. My T still fluctuates between 325-400 a year and a half later, I will be 67 in October. Posts.Title: Anyone using Firmagon after Lupron or Eligard

Posts.Content: switched Urologist after him not giving me any options on my HT. just finished my 6 month shot of Eligard which has made null and void. new doctor has given me other options and suggested the monthly Firmagon shot. from what i understand it is a painful shot, i don't think it could be worse than Eligard shot in my stomach. my biggest concern is I signed up for new insurance for 2015,my new Urologist does not except this plan. my company carved me out after working there for 43 years and did not find this out to signing up for new plan. I have Medicare A&B was wondering if anybody knows how much these shots cost. trying to figure out if I may need to go back to my old Urologist and demand the firmagon vs. Eligard. Both drugs achieve the same thing, just hoping the side affects are not as severe.
Posts.Title: Anyone using Firmagon after Lupron or Eligard

Posts.Content: Jim215, I have been retired for 2.5 years. turned 65 in October and my retiree insurance runs thru December. The company carved me out and know have to buy my own secondary insurance. because I am not primary starting in October my wife had to go over to Cobra which is quite abit more than we were paying for both of us. AT&T has a contract with AON to help determine what plans to choose from. We were given 15 minutes after going over 4 PPO carriers. only 1 out of 4 of my doctors would accept BCBST. my Urologist was the only one but they said their list was not up to date. after getting a 2nd opinion from a younger Urologist he answered all my guestions and offered other HT options. new plan is BlueCross Advantage plan which he does not accept. Oncologist and Radiology Oncologist do not accept either. then add insult to injury when I signed up with AON my drug coverage was discontinued as of 11-30. I have been getting the run around since 12-1 and still have no drug coverage. tuesday I go for my Firmagon shot, hope to find how much next year will I have to pay after Medicare. do not want to go back to my former Urologist, basically his way or no way. he did great on surgery but will not take time to consult with me. he adamant about me staying on HT for 3 years and so is my Oncologist. I was wondering how do I know if my 39 srt worked if the HT is suppressing my PSA. for the last 6 months my levels have stayed below 0.05 and as low as 0.02, my T is -3 at the end of my 6 month shot of Eligard. I do not know exactly where I stand, all scans have come back negative. the other thing is when is zero really zero, so as long as my PSA is not 00.0 the cancer is still there and growing?
Posts.Title: Anyone using Firmagon after Lupron or Eligard

Posts.Content: I received a 6 month shot of Eligard in the stomach, hurt like hell. Injected slowly and had a knot the size of my fist for 3 or 4 days. Bleed pretty good, the nurse put a circular band aid but missed the injection spot and my shirt was soaked before I got back to the car. I eventually opted out of HT after I finished my SRT, the side effects were tough on me. It worked out so far have been <.05 for 2.5 years. If I had not opted out of HT I would still be on it.

Posts.Title: Itching

Posts.Content: I would not take the 6 month shot of Firmagon maybe a 3 month or month to month. My Uro said if you go month to month you can take a vacation he called it. I opted out early with my HT, with the SRT combined with HT we hit hard. You can always go back on HT but with the 6 month dose you can't. It worked out for me, been over 4 years since my RP. Luckily I was retired when I went through all of this because I could not function on HT. Stayed in brain fog the whole time besides all the other side effects.

Posts.Title: Looking for opinion

Posts.Content: My testosterone tanked after opting out of HT, stayed in the low 200s for 1.5 years. Talked my Uro about TT, working out 4-5 days a week and not seeing any results. I gained over 20 lbs after my surgery, HT and SRT. Uro is a young guy and been asking about replacement therapy and he said we could try but need to be checked really close. I suggested from what I have been reading about Clomid, insurance won't pay but thought I would give it a try. In 1 month my Testosterone went from 246 to 424 and PSA still zero, feel better already. It is a female fertility drug but given to men increases testosterone naturally. So far no side effects, after only 7 weeks. Originally Uro suggested cutting pills in half which I did for 2 weeks, then did whole pill once a day for 2 weeks when he had me come to check my PSA. So far so good, time to get back in the gym. Just hope my T continues to go up, will know in 2 months, my next check up.

Posts.Title: Movember

Posts.Content: I for one would wait for no other reason you want to be continent as much as possible. My Uro said 1 year unless I felt I was healed and continent, he said where ever I was when starting radiation that would be best I would probably be. I never had clear margin and started HT 1 month after first 3 months checkup. About 1 month after starting HT started SRT. For the most part I am 95% continent with just an occasional squirt if I am in a strain of body twisted. ED is still present with no signs of regaining going on close to 3 years since RP. Drugs do not work, pump will not sustain an erection. Before I started HT my erections were getting to about 90% but I would leak urine which was a turn off to both of us when I was aroused. The SRT took care of that though permanently, I new going in had to hit it hard being staged T3b. I opted out of HT after a year, just couldn't deal with plus I was told it stays in your system for about the same amount time you where on it. My PSA has been zero for almost 2 years but testosterone has never recovered till recently. Started on Clomid 50 mg a day and one month it has doubled into the 400 range. Just having to keep a close eye on my PSA. January go back for PSA check and see what an additional 3 months of Clomid has done for me.

Posts.Title: Well it appears I am not immortal....testosterone related

Posts.Content: yes it is a side effect of HT. I lost most all of my under arm hair, my legs and arms the hair seemed to be finer than before. I had 39 SRTs so my belly hair was burned and came back later but finer like baby hair and was darker than my chest hair which is almost white. Posts.Content: i had the DaVinci RP, little incontinence for a few weeks, nothing major. ED problems remain after 2 1/2 months, doctor says they will get better give it time. what i have questions about is he wants my PSA to be 0.0, 30 days out had a reading of 0.06, 60 days out 0.07. i go back in 30 days, last visit he discussed beam radiation, clinical trials and meeting with oncologist. i more incline depending on my next blood work to take a slower approach. i do not want to be over treated. i was under the impression anything under < 0.1 was considered undetectable. will decide after 3 month reading what the plan of attack is going to be. just want to know how many men after a RP have a 0.0 reading. i think things are moving to fast, need to get back to normal before another round of meds start. my urologist is good surgeon but does not spend the time to answer all of my questions. guess he has done his job, now handing me off to an oncologist after this next blood work. before all this started back around Thanksgiving i was healthy 64 yo, work out 4-5 days a week, retired with multiple hobbies. no warning signs or problems prior to discovery on a complete physical. did not expect to be cured completely after the RP, do not want side effects of the the cure to be worse than living with the disease.

Posts.Title: A new member of the club no one wants to join

Posts.Content: my wife was very understanding and was willing to do anything it took for us to be intimate. some of the wives on this forum need to answer this with support. your numbers were almost exactly as mine, G8 and staged 3tb in Dec 2013, Da Vinci Feb 2014. started HT in June then SRT and finished 3rd of October. Lupron will probably hinder you getting an erection without some help, lowers your Testostrone. your wife needs to be more sympathetic to the changes your body is going through. you are still early in your recovery, she needs to undertand this. as far as incontinence it is still early also, have her read the stickies at the top of this forum. you did not give your age which would help with others to chime in on that are about same age group.
Posts.Title: Frustrated

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by rwewpar4 Where did you have your surgery? I had my surgery at Vattikuti Urology Institute at Henry Ford in Detroit. My surgeon was the first to perform a robotic prostate surgery world wide in 2001. I noticed that you are from Collierville, Tn, My wife is from Paris, Tn. We live in Ohio but we are in Florida for the winter. When you went on the HT were the side effects immediate or were the progressive the longer you were on the HT. Were you on Lupron. I got the shot on 1/23/2015 and have had no side effects that I can recall. From what the medical people told me I expected more side effects. Do get me wrong. If this is as bad as it gets I'm ok with that. I assume you were asking me. I took the 6 month Eligard shot which might be a litle different. at first not really feeling anything but feeling out of sorts. then the hot flashes started, ankles starting swelling, breasts were tender and the twins starting shrinking along with itching down there. a general weakness took over, I walk 4-5 miles 5 days a week and lift weights at fitness center 3-4 times a week. I switched Urologists and he has recommended the monthly HT over the 3 or 6 month shots.

Posts.Title: Bone Scans/Blood Tests

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Fairwind What exactly do you hope to gain by the TRT? Many men think it's some sort of magical fountain of youth but it seldom meets that expectation..If your cancer has been CURED, it's no problem..But if it's just in remission, you will find that out soon enough, with or without the TRT.....Just my opinion... before finding out I had prostate cancer I was on TT for a 1.5 years, getting tested every 3 months. Evidently my doctor was not testing my blood for psa only testosterone. During the time I was taking the replacement for the first 7-8 months every 4 weeks switched to every 2 weeks. I had been working out 4-5 times a week until the biweekly shots saw very little change but suddenly dropped 25 lbs. and starting putting on muscle mass. Went from 218 to 192 over next 3-4 months of 2 week therapy. Knew I was getting much stronger because I could hardly bend to take a piss in the morning and now could bend it easily. LOL. Seriously, not having any ed issues before it seemed to be harder than before. Lost my belly fat which had always been the hardest place to lose while on TT. Now I am back to 208 and tried watching what I eat and don't have the energy to work out at the fitness center 2-3 times a week. When I was on the TT therapy after working out at night laying in bed my whole tingled and felt so good. Always very active and my job was very physical working sometimes 12-16 hours a day in the outside year round. Started the TT a year after retiring and was fountain of youth for me. I tried to get my medical records from my primary care doctor after I stopped the replacement therapy but never received them. Stonewalled at every avenue short of getting a lawyer, even my Uro asked for them and no go. A friends brother had PC and doctor let him start back after 5 years of clear margins. After HT, I know how bad it is not to have any T, would like to get back to having some more energy again. From what I have read their are 2 schools of thought on testosterone and pc. Most studies are from 1960s. Haven't decided yet whether I will start back on TT, just looking at some of the newer studies. Wondering if anybody on here started TT.
Posts.Title: Testosterone Therapy after surgery, ht and srt

Posts.Content: I have had 2 years of undetectable psa readings along with low 200s testosterone. Been after my Uro about starting testosterone therapy and we discussed it today. He said we could give it a go but would have to be tested every 6 weeks. Newer studies go against the standard of waiting 5-10 years, this is what I have read, not my Uro. I know I am higher risk but I feel it is worth taking. Staged 3tb with a g8. What do you think? 67yo by the way.
Posts.Title: Testosterone Therapy after surgery, ht and srt

Posts.Content: 22, you can add brain fog to all of the above. The toll the surgery, ADT and SRT I believe contributed to heart problems. Before all this began I had no high blood pressure and signs of problems. I was one of the lucky ones that had every side effect of Eligard taking 6 month shot. Uro stated I would probably be on it for 5 years, I opted out after 1.5 years. Today is the anniversary of my RP and have been zero for over 2 years. PSA was 10.6 and staged T3b. My testosterone never recovered, staying around 200 till 4 months ago when put on Clomid which brought up around 400. Hoping it keeps coming up a bit.

Posts.Title: Hope for men suffering Hot Flashes after starting HT

Posts.Content: meet with my oncologist Monday, scheduled a Bone and CT scan for friday and monday. psa went from .06 at 30days to .07 at 60 to .08 at 90 then 0.1 at 120 days. got a 3 month shot of Eliqard 2 weeks ago from urologist, feeling a little puny after about 10days of the shot. Oncologist is setting me up for salvage radiation after scans and said I will be on HT for 3 years. 7 weeks of radiation to start, wasn't ready for 3 years of HT. from reading on here and other sites thought they would monitor my PSA to see how long it takes to double from the 3 month blood work. will my body adjust to HT or will it get worse as time goes along? seems i have a mild case of every side effect listed on drup site. swollen ankles, aching testicles, hot flashes and tired feeling. i work out at the fitness center doing weight training, treadmill and elliptical 4-5 days a week and can feel the effects plus i have gained about 8lbs. in 2 weeks. maybe just be retaining fluid. just as i was was making progress in ED department, this comes along. i go on medicare october 1st, what a way to spend my retirement.

Posts.Title: Rising PSA after RP, started HT

Posts.Content: I have a full head of hair and the 4 guys I know with PC all have a full head of hair. My HT has caused me to lose body hair, radiation did away from navel to the top of Little Elvis. Pubic has come back but not my lower belly, just fine peach fuzz now. My upper chest hair has turned from coarse to fine and my underarm is almost gone. Arm and leg hair has thinned out but still have fairly heavy leg hair. It has been 6 months since I finished SRT and tomorrow I go for a checkup with my RO. I don't go along with the baldness theory, plus I had low T.
Posts.Title: Baldness - PCa

Posts.Content: Lupron can definetly cause fatigue, some people tolerate better than others from what I gather on here. I lift weights regularly and what ever I do I have hit a plateau on HT. my Urologist said to definetly keep up the regiment of walking and working out. the hot flashes are another side effect that bother me. I think your Dad needs a HT vacation, from what I have read after a few years the cancer works around the HT. read where 6 months on 6 months works better, I have been of my HT for 4 months and the side are effects are still the same. some side effects have lessened but the fatigue and loss of libido still linger. the twins are still shriveled up and still losing body hair. I am a year younger than your Dad. this tuesday I go for another PSA and testosterone test, going to ask for a full blood workup.
Posts.Title: Lupron seemingly causing Fatigue, possible solutions?

Posts.Content: PSA 10.6, gleason 8, staged at t3b. probably will start the salvage radiation after the 4th. 6 months since bone and ct scan, surgery was in Feb. no incontinence problems, no prostate trouble prior to finding on a physical.
Posts.Title: Rising PSA after RP, started HT

Posts.Content: My urologist wanted to keep me on the HT for 3 years, I opted out 3 months after SRT. Changed Urologists who gave me some options where the other did not. Kept a close eye on my PSA every 6 weeks while my testosterone was still very low, as it was creeping up changed to every 3 months. Now that my T is in the 400 range back to every 2 months. So far my PSA has been <0.05 which is as low as the lab reads for 1 year. Doc told me the affects of HT can be 6 months to a year, my T took about 4 months to start an upward trend from zero. I did not tolerate HT very well at all. Being active and keeping a workout log for the last 3 years at the fitness center, I could see my health and strength do a nose dive. Don't know when the time comes with a reoccurrence that I will go back on HT. With a G8 and staged at 3tb mu urologist said there is a 70% that it will pop back up. As with Inquiring Mind, I asked my doctor how can we tell if the SRT worked or is it HT keeping my psa undectable, inquiring mind want to know.
Posts.Title: Two Years of HT alongside salvage radiation

Posts.Content: curious about the testosterone, i thought it feed cancer cells. the doctors have me on ADT to stop my body from making T.
Posts.Title: Update: 9 months post RALP

Posts.Content: my Urologist said it depends on how I was healing and being continent, besides the doubling time. I started my SRT about 6 months after surgery, would have been sooner but getting everything lined up with the Oncologist and the RO was the holdup. when my psa went to 0.11 started the ball rolling and started HT knocking my psa to 0.05 in 1 month.
Posts.Title: Delaying RT after surgery may of worse outcomes then doing it ASAP

Posts.Content: I was basically in the same situation, had our first cruise ever booked and paid for. 5 weeks prior to leaving had the DaVinci, every thing went pretty smoothly. Dry nights but up 3 times a night, urge would wake me up. Only had minor leakage when up and about, one pad during the day before leaving. Had a 8 hour drive, my wife was driving Mr. Daisy, my thimble bladder and 2 other vehicles of family prevented from stopping every hour. The cruise was great but constantly needing a rest room was pita. Wished I would have waited or canceled the trip, I did have the trip insurance so would of got most of my money back. I think the trip set me back on my recovery, between adult beverages and fruit which are diuretics. My situation was a little more dire than yours, thinking maybe could of been put on Casodex till I returned. I am not as well informed as most on here but something just does seem right with that big a jump. Maybe you have a mild infection from them making a pin cushion out of your prostate. Good Luck!

Posts.Title: Lupron and weight gain

Posts.Content: probably over 20 years ago I saw a cartoon joke in Playboy mag. an eldery woman was talking to a beautiful well endowed young lady. the young lady was telling the woman her boyfriend wanted to have oral sex. she told her to give it to her boyfriend and said " most men aren't satisfied just talking about it". thought I would add a little humor, hope ya'll think it is funny.
Posts.Title: My ED problems reminded me of a joke

Posts.Content: 4 months after my RP was placed on HT, 6 month shot of Eligard which is similar to the Lupron. I had a rising PSA after surgery, about 6 weeks after the shot started the SRT. 39 treatments, hitting with both guns. at 5 months and 2 weeks my T was .03 my Urologist wants me to stay on the HT for 3 years, the side effects are no fun. went to another Urologist for a second opinion about staying on the HT. told him I wanted to do a 3 month holiday and see if SRT worked, just got tested Tuesday, waiting to get results. Dr. Pat Walsh says sometimes later than sooner on the HT. some of the new data states 18 months is about as long as you should stay on it. HT is not a cure from what I read, it just suppresses it and after awhile the cancer figures out away around it. my PSA as been as low as 0.02 and the Doctor wants me to stay on it. depending on the results from this past Tuesday will depend if start my AS. just as I was getting my mojo back the HT killed it, Little Elvis has left the building. the twins have started turning to mush, tender breasts, weight gain and the hot flashes not to mention loss of energy. your situation is different than mine so this is my take on HT. you need to get the latest edition of Pat Walsh book on PC. I don't wish HT on anybody, some people on here have little trouble with it.
Posts.Title: Lupron question

Posts.Content: I too was on HT and SRT after my RP. After my SRT my Uro wanted me to stay on HT for 3-5 years and I did not tolerate having no testosterone. Opted out of HT after finishing my SRT about 6 months later. I just decided I wanted to know if the radiation did it's job or HT was holding my PSA down. Luckily I have been zero for the last 3 years. We threw everything at it at once, 30 days after my SRT I was <0.05 and has stayed undetectable. You can always start HT if needed but I am firm believer it does too much damage to the body. Just keep a watch on his PSA, my Uro said before I started SRT it could take up to a year for it to work. I was 10.6 PSA and a G8 staged at 3tb and in my mid 60s.

Posts.Title: Srt. Where do they aim/ put the tattoos ?

Posts.Content: I am 65 and had no symptons of PC. discovered my high PSA, 10.6 on my physical. no urinary, ed or pain problems. after RP i felt like i had prostate problems because of having to get up at night to empty. really had no incontinence, a little dribble when i did my kegels. after about 2 months my ed was starting to go away but not yet firm enough for sex. getting better in that department week by week but PSA was also rising. Doctor started me on HT and that killed any thought of improving and the side effects are bad. then they added 8 weeks of salvage radiation, another set back. still trying to get my PSA to 0.00 undectable but keeping me on HT for now starting my 7th month. the surgery itself was a very easy on me, only took 1 pain pill when i got home. it was more just to sleep because of master strapped to my leg. radiation therapy caused little side effects and only lasted a couple of days. went in for surgery in the morning and went home late the next afternoon. the only pain was from the gas they bloat you up with when i would first sat up in bed. the gas migrates up in your shoulders, at least in me. I was up and walking with my master the same day of surgery. something i tried to get my doctor to do was give me the daily Cialis for 30 days prior to surgery and after to help with blood flow for healing purposes. seems that some members on here have done this, makes sense to me.

Posts.Title: Not sure I know where I am going

Posts.Content: when are you doing your Kegels? I found out after doings my Kegels while driving my truck that is when I leaked. when I would hold it and then released is when it happened. Posts.Content: Went for an ultra sound and mammogram Tuesday for the painful lump in left breast. Doc said treatment would interfere with my active surveillance. The pain is worse at times and may go away, he attributed to being on the HT. I had sore breast when on HT but no lumps and subsided after opting out after a few months. Referred to an endocrinologist, the 23rd. It has been almost a year since opted out of HT but it is the gift that keeps on giving. Gynecomastia is what I was diagnosed with, will just keep a check monthly like a woman for changes. Have a slight lump in right breast but no pain, really haven't noticed anything but showed up on both tests. Always said they were trying to make a woman out of me, surely not the man I use to be.
Posts.Title: Noticed a lump in my left breast

Posts.Content: For the last couple of weeks started dribbling again when I sneeze or cough a few drops. Today after traveling in my truck about to bust a gut, finally got to my destination headed to the restroom, every step I released quite a bit of urine. Needless to say I was embarrassed and very noticeable in my shorts. From day 1 after cath removed had dry nights, urge would wake me up, only had minimal leakage during the day for a couple of weeks. Now this has started up worse than the beginning of my journey another problem has sprung up. When I take a Viagra and start getting aroused I start squirting urine also. To say this kills the mood is under statement, still do the Keges when I think about, not just every day. Started back doing them every day, maybe this is for life now. Even after emptying my bladder if my wife tugs on it, it is like she is milking a cow. I don't drink coffee and limit myself to 1 12 ounce soda a day usually at lunch. Almond milk in the morning or regular 2% and water at dinner or occasionally tea. Cut out drinking beer mainly because I started back in end of April riding a motorcycle. See my Urologist this coming Tuesday for my 3 month psa check up. I just don't understand what caused this to startup, could it have to do with nerve sparring. By the way, I turned 66 the 4th of this month, great present I have gotten. The gift that keeps on giving.
Posts.Title: 19 months post surgery, 1 year since finished SRT, what is up with this?

Posts.Content: I think I would change Doctors. had he had regular checkups prior to this? others will chime in on here, could be nothing or could be the worse and you only have one chance to get it right.
Posts.Title: Did husband's doctor make a big mistake?

Posts.Content: Much as I hate to recommend it, you could start on HT while waiting to start SRT. This should stop your rise in PSA, will kill your libido put could give to time for incontinence to improve.
Posts.Title: Not Again......

Posts.Content: Well, I had all the side effects listed in your first post. You will not have any testosterone, it will be zero. Do the monthly shots, definitely don't take the 6 month. I opted out of HT some 6 months following SRT. My PSA has been <0.05 for close to 2 years and testosterone is in 200s and has not rebounded as have the twins.
Posts.Title: Advise on Lupron (Eligard) usage

Posts.Content: after coming off of Eligard my testosterone came up into the low 400s after about 6 months. since then has been steadily decreasing to less than 200 with no sign of increasing. I developed gynecomastia, with lumps in both breasts with the left side very tender. when i would roll on my left at night it would wake me up. had a couple of mammograms, thinking breast cancer but not. Doctor more or less said my body was confused from the hormone therapy taking my testosterone to zero. I opted out 6 months after finishing my SRT. could not take the side effects of HT, also think it had something to do with heart problems which I never had had. for me opting out of HT for 2 years has been the right choice, <0.05 for the last 2 years. still have side effects from low T. thinking of starting testosterone replacement therapy, Urologist said I could start but would need to come in for PSA testing every 6 weeks to be checked.
Posts.Title: Reclinging Testosterone 18 months AFTER last Lupron? And also Multiple Kidney stones

Posts.Content: monthly after my RP my PSA went from 0.06, 0.07, 0.08 to the 4th month 0.10. recieved an Eligard shot and a month later my PSA went to 0.05. met with an Oncologist which referred me for salvage radiation. this took about 6 weeks to set up with the Radiology Oncologist to start the treatmants. about 5 weeks into S R back to the urologist, my PSA was 0.02. going in the right direction, go back to the Oncologist 2 weeks after radiation was over, PSA was <0.064 which is as low as they read. why would they not use a more ultra sensitive test? this just confused me plus staying on HT for 3 years. I guess i have to wait to the middle of november when i go back to my Urologist to find out the salvage radiation worked. thinking of discontinuing the HT, not so sure if it is worth it from reading numerous studies.
Posts.Title: Not sure I know where I am going

Posts.Content: was there a reason the catheter stayed in 12 days, seems a little longer than normal. are you doing your kegel exercises while dressed wearing a pad? i noticed the only time i wet my pad was when i did my Kegels, started doing them sitting on the toilet. stayed dry for the most part with only one pad a day, stress incontinence only. i could start and stop my stream from day 1 but had no feeling, had to look down to confirm. it will get better, stay away from fruit juices, diet drinks and beer.
Posts.Title: HELP Post Prostate Surgery

Posts.Content: I opted out of HT and after 6 months my testosterone was still zero. Now a year and half later it is in the low 300s. according to lab it should be 350-900. If you could post your age and testosterone level it would help me figure out where I stand. ED still present, pills and even the pump doesn't work, I must the 5% it doesn't work on. Double whammy of SRT and HT has for now tamed the beast, now if little Elvis would come back in the building. By the way I will be 67 in October and had no issues with ED prior to surgery.

AgeInfo.Phrase: the way I will be 67 in October and had no

Posts.Title: Curious to what everyones testosterone levels are

Posts.Content: sorry to hear the bad news, I was almost there myself. I was staged T3b with positive margins, the HT will suppress the cancer. seems a little early to me to start SRT, my Urologist waited 6 months to make sure I was healed and not incontinent. I know he knows more than me but their is a chance the SRT will clean up anything left. from what I have read they likw to wait a full year before SRT or at least wait to see the PSA doubling time. there alot more on hear that have more knowledge than me that will chime in. I was given a 50/50 chance of beating this, at the least keeping it under control for a long time. your post PSA will tell a lot, I had a steady rise from 0.06 to 0.11 in 4 months time. started my HT at the end of the 4th month and took about 2 months to meet with Radiology Oncologist to schedule my SRT. your husbands age and PSA before surgery will help plus what type surgery? hope for the best
Posts.Title: Not what we expected

Posts.Content: I have been in the zero club since I have finished SRT. not ready to celebrate just yet but my PSA has been <0.05 since completing radiation. finished my SRT October 3, 2014 and opted out of HT since the first of this year. went from every 6 weeks to 3 month checkups, hoping it stays down. congrats on your zero, your stats show no HT, so good luck.
Posts.Title: Back in the 0 Club!

Posts.Content: appointment Tuesday to get checked out, may not be associated with HT. WebMD says HT can trigger recessive genes in males. Seems strange before HT never had heart problems, my daughter has worked at a heart clinic for 12 years and has kept me up on my checkups. Back in middle of June had 3 stents after having a tightness in my chest, Urologist said was probably just fatigue from HT. Heart problems could be attributed to the HT along with painful breasts which I had while on it. To me the risks and quality of life on HT out weigh the benefits. I opted out of HT after 3 months past my SRT was completed, took 6 months for my side affects to subside. My Oncologist wanted me stay on HT for 3 years as my Urologist did also. The lump probably isn't cancerous but hope it is just a gland. My testosterone is slowing coming back, only 269 up from 3 months ago of 246.

Posts.Title: Did husband's doctor make a big mistake?

Posts.Content: not exactly the same as you but PSA rose steadily from 1st month after DaVinci. 0.06, 0.07, 0.08 to 0.10 at 4th month after surgery. finished my salvage radiation october 3, 39 treatmants, 65 years old. really was not to bad, a little burning in the rectum with a bm. this only started after about 5 weeks in, if you watch your diet and eat bland food it helps. no Mexican food, at least for me, i tried. what little burning i did have was gone 1 week at last treatmant. i did receive some manscaping below my navel to top of Little Elvis. did not realize before the RP that i would have this shrinkage, need to be circumcised know. just as i was getting all my functions back, they put me on HT. this is worse than the radiation, hard to deal with these side effects.

Posts.Title: PSA rising (slowly) after prostatectomy

Posts.Content: I had a rising PSA after DaVinci surgery, 4 months later put on 6 month injection of Eligard. 6 weeks later started SRT, 39 treatments. I strongly recommend not taking the 6 month injection, monthly or 3 month at the most would be better. It took me 6 months after opting out of the HT to start feeling half way better. So far after SRT and opting out of HT my PSA has been <0.05. My question while doing both at the same time was how do I know if the radiation cleaned up what was left. The Eligard took my PSA from 0.11 to 0.05 in 6 weeks and during the SRT as low as 0.02. When it came time for the next 6 month shot I opted out and changed Urologist. The lab my new doctor uses only reads to 0.05 my PSA has been <0.05 for the last 8 months. Dr. Pat Walsh in his books thinks later than sooner when it comes to HT. I don't think Doctors realize how hard HT is on us, I know some tolerate better than others. 9 months after my initial injection, 3 months after opting out my testosterone was still castration level. Now my T is slowly coming back but only 249 now. Besides little Elvis has left the building, hot flashes, increased belly fat, the twins turn to mush and low energy to name a few. With me thinning of body hair, I know the radiation burned the hair on my lower belly but under arm hair all but gone. Where I had hairy legs it is still there just thinner and shorter. I work out at least 3-4 days a week with weights and walk 4-5 miles 5-6 days a week. Every time I work out no matter how hard I try I have hit a wall or regress, that is what no T does for you. Every time I go to the fitness center before PC and after I log my workouts for reps, sets and weights. Most people on here will recommend both HT and SRT combined but from reading some other just do the SRT.

Posts.Title: Rising PSA (again) post RP - questions

Posts.Content: Brave, HT is kicking my ass, I quess everybody is different. weight gain is definetly a problem, mine main complaint is weight gain is lower than my regular belly. I call it a pooch like a woman has. with no T, fatigue is also bad. I am very active senior 65 yo, I have to force myself to go to the gym and walk. would run but an old injury has left my ankle rubbing bone on bone. just this past week I cut down a 65 foot sweet gum tree and hauled it off myself. had to sit down about every 30 minutes and catch my breath. this saturday took my Grandaughter into the woods carrying a 2 man blind and 2 chairs to get ready for a turkey hunt. if I just sit on the couch other than hot flashes and my ankles swelling, don't notice the fatgue. so many on here hardly have any side affects, guess I wasn't so lucky. when the time comes to start back on HT, my new Urologist is putting me on Firmagon. he said I might tolerate it better and is once a month instead of the 6 month Eligard.

AgeInfo.Phrase: I am very active senior 65 yo  I have to force

Posts.Title: Thoughts on my Hormone Treatment

Posts.Content: I recieved a 6 month shot of Eligard on June 12th. it almost immediately cut my PSA from 0.11 to 0.05 in 4 weeks time. during the next few months all the trouble started, hot flashes, tender breasts, testicle shrinkage, swollen ankles, tiredness and trouble thinking. December 18th scheduled for another round but did not have it. fast forward to March 3rd, almost 3 months past due, still having most of the side affects. Hot flashes and night sweats still happening regular. my Psa on 3-3-2015 is <0.05 and testostrone is 0.3. thought I would be feeling better and T would come up a little in that amount of time. I work with weights at least 3 times a week and walk 4 miles 5 days a week in the morning. have hit a wall for the last 3 months, can not lift heavier weights or walk much further without getting winded. my daughter works at a major heart clinic and now I have developed an irregular heart beat. I attribute all this to HT, I wish I could get on T replacement therapy. not sure what I am going to do when PSA starts rising again, just hope the SRT did its job.

Posts.Title: Thoughts on my Hormone Treatment

Posts.Content: I had 39 SRTs and the amount of time I was on the table was shorter starting around the last 8 treatments. I noticed the area was more confined, so less time on the table. 3 months after finishing my SRT I opted out of the ADT. This was against the Doctors will but could not tolerate having no testosterone. ADT for me is the gift that keeps on giving. 1 year and 2 months and dealing with the lingering effects. Besides still having ED problems, I now have small breasts, Gynecomastia. They are very painful, started out just one was sore now both are. In a wait and see or active surveillance on my man boobs.

Posts.Title: Radiation "Boost"

Posts.Content: Doctor had me do one before my biopsy. I would go with your gut feeling and go for it.
Posts.Title: Enema: Yes? No? Maybe?

Posts.Content: Not the surgery but after being on HT I went from having CRS (can't remember shit) to having CRAFT (can't remember a f--king thing). My mind was foggy during the HT for real, didn't start right away but it affected my whole being.
Posts.Title: RALPH & Memory

Posts.Content: i received my Eligard 6 month shot in the stomach, a little painfull. started hot flashes right away, aching and shrinking testes in the first month. tender breasts after working out and restless nights waking up sweating. the good news is my PSA after surgery went from 0.10 at 4 months to 0.05 30 days after HT. start my salvage radiation on August 11th. sex drive is zero, still think about it but Lil Elvis has left the building. have gained 10 lbs. since HT started and no energy to workout, cut down to 1 hour a day everyother day down from 5 days a week for 1.5-2 hours. i do 10-12 reps 4 sets going up 5-10 lbs each set and not being able to go up weight every other week. just struggling to keep my weights that i had worked up to. my wife says i am going through menopause, welcome to their world.
Posts.Title: What I Need to Know About HT

Posts.Content: usually do a combo of both, at least with me. i have finished my salvage radiation, 8 weeks. was not bad at all, the HT as been worse on me than SR. i would take radiation over HT anyday. say good by to the twins, breast pain, retaining fluid, belly fat and no energy from zero testostrone. i am Eligard 6 month shot, almost 5 months in and can still feel the knot in my stomach where i got the shot. not exactly painless, hugh needle and bleed pretty good afterwards. no sex drive and can't even if i wanted to, just i was regaining my form the HT killed it. radiation is a piece of cake.

Posts.Content: usually do a combo of both, at least with me. i have finished my salvage radiation, 8 weeks. was not bad at all, the HT as been worse on me than SR. i would take radiation over HT anyday. say good by to the twins, breast pain, retaining fluid, belly fat and no energy from zero testostrone. i am Eligard 6 month shot, almost 5 months in and can still feel the knot in my stomach where i got the shot. not exactly painless, hugh needle and bleed pretty good afterwards. no sex drive and can't even if i wanted to, just i was regaining my form the HT killed it. radiation is a piece of cake.

Posts.Title: What I Need to Know About HT

Posts.Content: I just think it varies from person to person. dependent on whether it is monthly, 3 month or 6 month shot. I also believe, now this just me, someone with already low testostrone may not notice is as much as a person with higher T. could be wrong, may just be the other way. if and when I have to back on HT, my new Urologist suggest that we try Firmagon. I know nothing about this drug, he tried to explain it but didn't understand the difference. need to read up on this drug, it is given monthly, I have been off HT since the middle of December when I was due for another dose. still having hot flashes, night sweats and loss of libido.
Posts.Title: Lupron, Eligard, Lupron Depot, and Viadur

Posts.Content: Mole, from what I have read the wait is about a year before SRT. alot depends on doubling time, mine was started about 6 months after my DaVinci. Doc only started me because of how I healed and was not incontinent. my ED was about there after 4 months but a month later was given HT. Little Elvis has left the building for sure with after HT and SRT have not seen any lift off. ED pills do not work for me at least not yet, only came off the HT 3 months ago but my Testostrone is still less than 3. my PSA was <.05 on 12-1-2014 and <.05 on 3-3-2015. radiation was not bad at all, some serious manscaping took place between my navel and L E. like everyone else can not understand why you don't have your results yet.
Posts.Title: Question about Adjuvant Radiation

Posts.Content: I for one could hardly tolerate the HT, only had the 6 month shot of Eligard. may have tolerated if I recieved the monthly or 3 month shot. right now have been off of HT for 3 months and still feel bad. it affected my thought process along with the fatigue, breast swelling, loss of body hair and libido. I had SRT right in the middle of HT. alot of new data says 18 months is long enough. after awhile the cancer finds a way around it, some suggest 6 months on and 6 months off. I made the decision to stop my HT to see if the SRT worked, otherwise how can you tell if the HT is suppressing the cancer or did the radiation work. was fine with HT in the beginning it brought my PSA down from 0.11 to 0.05 in a months time. urologist and I are keeping and eye on my PSA which is <.05 as low as the lab reads. not sure how Lupron compares to Eligard but it brought my testostrone down to .03 and still down 3 months. say goodbye to the twins, they turn to almost mush, at least mine did. I see a stranger when I get out of the shower and then get depressed. hope you are able to tolerate better than me, always been very active and now have to make myself leave the house. I quess it is better than the alternative. good luck
Posts.Title: Starting Lupron

Posts.Content: make sure you leave with the large catheter bag, I was sent home with a small bag strapped to my ankle. my wife had to drive back an hour to the hospital to get the bigger one. no where else to get them, we called pharmacies and no luck. like other have said, a piece of cake. my Urologist gave me a dvd to watch, did not watch it. figured what they do to me will I was under doesn't matter. good luck and don't sweat it, gives you some more time to do your Kegels. Doctor told me to have as much sex as I could. after surgery ask for the once a day Cialis to help blood flow for the healing process.
Posts.Title: Scared of Meeting da Vinci

Posts.Content: has your Urologist talked to you about starting Hormone Therapy. I was started on HT about 6 weeks before starting SRT after rising PSA when it reached 0.11 Doctor wanted to hit hard with both barrels. radiation was not that bad, just a little burning toward the end of the 30th treatment.

Age.Phrase: <Z> <Z> I will be 66 in October  just my experience

PatientDecided.Sample: the surgery itself was a very easy on me, only took 1 pain pill when i got home. it was more just to sleep because of master strapped to my leg....i had the aggressive type cancer waited 6 weeks the talked to the Urologist to decide best plan of attack. i decided surgery but could not schedule for almost 4 weeks, put on Casodex....alot depends on doubling time, mine was started about 6 months after my DaVinci. Doc only started me because of how I healed and was not incontinent....
